CricketMatch.MatchReport:
A long journey into Hampshire for Twyford this week as they travelled to the lovely ground of Eversley (Complete with smashing pub opposite).

There had been a lot of rain in the preceding 24 hours, but winning the toss the home team decided to bat first. This turned out to be a justified decision, as the slow pitch and some rather lacklustre bowling helped them on their way. Anything short popped up invitingly for the batsmen, and anything over-pitched was dealt with confidence. Lawrence was especially devastating at bat, scoring an excellent, hard-hitting 96, ably supported by Brooks & Martin. Only Cochrane (more of him later...) bowled with any degree of economy, going for just 18 of his 6 overs. The final total of 203-3 loomed large for the visitors, with only 10 men and on paper at least not having the strongest batting side - Things looked bleak for Twyford.

Despite these worries, Twyford's innings began well with Benjamin & Cochrane finding the conditions as much to their liking as had Eversley. A good run rate was set, and when Davies joined Cochrane at bat in the 8th over, things got better yet. Cochrane especially was enjoying himself, having not played on a Sunday for some time now, he struck the ball to all corners with some well timed shots, and some that were just pure brute strength! Eighteen 4's and one six (whiched bounced off the bonnet of a Porsche in the pub car park!) saw him score his first every century for the club in a dazzling display, putting Twyford within shooting distance of victory. It came down to the last over - Twyford needed just 8 runs for victory. But Eversley were resolute - Their fielding which had been excellent throughout the afternoon did not fail them. The visitors ended just 3 runs short of victory - A draw being the fair and proper outcome to the game.

So what had looked like certain defeat for the visitors had turned in to a thrilling finish. Praise of course for Cochrane, but also for the many colts players on the Twyford side who acquitted themselves with style - We look forward to seeing more of them in the coming seasons.

And praise too for our hosts - A fine, friendly & well-matched opposition.
